00686 /* When you read VLEN type the library will actually allocate the
00687  * storage space for the data. This storage space must be freed, so
00688  * pass the pointer back to this function, when you're done with the
00689  * data, and it will free the vlen memory. */
00690 EXTERNL int
00691 nc_free_vlen(nc_vlen_t *vl);

00747  * will be <= NC_MAX_NAME. */

01742 /* #ifdef _CRAYMPP */
01743 /*
01744  * Public interfaces to better support
01745  * CRAY multi-processor systems like T3E.
01746  * A tip of the hat to NERSC.
01747  */
01748 /*
01749  * It turns out we need to declare and define
01750  * these public interfaces on all platforms
01751  * or things get ugly working out the
01752  * FORTRAN interface. On !_CRAYMPP platforms,
01753  * these functions work as advertised, but you
01754  * can only use "processor element" 0.
01755  */
01756 
01757 EXTERNL int
01758 nc__create_mp(const char *path, int cmode, size_t initialsz, int basepe,
01759    size_t *chunksizehintp, int *ncidp);
01760 
01761 EXTERNL int

01763   size_t *chunksizehintp, int *ncidp);
01764

01766 nc_delete(const char *path);
01767 
01768 EXTERNL int
01769 nc_delete_mp(const char *path, int basepe);

01772 nc_set_base_pe(int ncid, int pe);

01775 nc_inq_base_pe(int ncid, int *pe);
